flow.descriptionCdata:
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.2b926af2-6c0a-40a8-887a-26a319863165.transition.description=Server is Not Responding or Couldn't Connect to Server 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.2bbeac22-4079-4d0f-bf33-2445925ad67b.prompt=Web Application \: 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.33309588-a472-4896-9e48-bf8a730cefc3.prompt=Number of seconds to sleep\: 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.38d1f693-43d9-493b-8a6d-76fe1800277c.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.3cd333aa-f32e-4540-acdb-83dbb72207e2.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
from - The number to start counting at.
to - The number to count to.
incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. If unspecified this is 1. If you wanted to count 2,4,6,8 this would be 2.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

NOTE\: These values must be between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Note\: the primary result is resultString, Result can also be used. result (All lower case) should not be used as it is the response code.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.654e70ff-61ea-48dd-af23-ea04c60b08f1.prompt=Number of seconds to sleep\: 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.7487601e-bd2d-4da9-b72b-2119a6fe2e41.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.9d1d8b40-510c-407e-8026-78a55081698c.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
from - The number to start counting at.
to - The number to count to.
incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. If unspecified this is 1. If you wanted to count 2,4,6,8 this would be 2.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

NOTE\: These values must be between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Note\: the primary result is resultString, Result can also be used. result (All lower case) should not be used as it is the response code.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.a71778ee-9a27-45b5-a41a-2f71232929b2.description=
Service to deploy Tomcat web application

Inputs\: 

host                                        - the host with tomcat installed.
managerURL                           - the url of the tomcat manager.
action                                     -  the action to be performed.
webapp                                  - the name of the web application to perform the action on.
username                               - user name  for tomcat application.
password                               - password for tomcat application.


Responses\:

success                                    - the operation succeeded.
failure                                      - an error occurred.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.a784c866-8e04-45da-aaef-0d4d72b1d84e.description=
List all the deployed application in Tomcat server.

Inputs\: 

host                                         - the host with tomcat installed.
managerURL                            - the url of the tomcat manager.
action                                      -  the action to be performed.
username                               - user name  for tomcat application.
password                               - password for tomcat application.

Responses\:

success                                    - the operation succeeded.
failure                                      - an error occurred.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.b5391a73-d984-4e95-becb-5fa8fc2a826f.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.b5391a73-d984-4e95-becb-5fa8fc2a826f.prompt=Below is List of Applications which are deployed on Server \: ${ListOfApplications} 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.b6ccd063-f4e5-42fc-89a1-b029ec0eb30c.description=
Tests a list of URLS to make sure they are responding.

Inputs\:
    List - The list of URLS that will be tested.
    seperator - A separator that is placed between each url that is in the list (must not be in any of the URLs themselves...).
    username - A username to use when connecting to the URLs.
    password - A password to use when connecting to the URLs.
    notifyMethod - How you would like to be notified of the test's outcome.
    timeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for a connection to be established. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A timeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    socketTimeout - The number of milliseconds to wait for the data to be retrieved. This input should be assigned a value greater than or equal to zero. A socketTimeout value of zero is an infinite timeout.
Default value\: 0.
    useCookies - Enables cookie tracking. Cookies will be stored between consecutive calls. 
Default value\: true.
    followRedirects - Specifies whether or not the get command should automatically follow redirects.
Default value\: false.
    proxy - A proxy to use when accessing the web site.
    proxyPort - The port on the proxy to connect to.
    proxyUsername - The username to use when connecting to the proxy.
    proxyPassword - The password to use when connecting to the proxy.
    encodeURL - If true, automatically encodes the URL. This is a boolean input. If a non-boolean value is specified, it will take the default value.
Default value\: false.
    userAgent - The value that should be used if the HTTP header USER_AGENT has to be overridden.
    characterSet - The character encoding that should be used for the HTTP Get request and response. 
Default value\: UTF-8.
    trustAllRoots - Specifies whether to enable weak security over SSL. A SSL certificate is trusted even if no trusted certification authority issued it.
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: true
    keystore - The location of the KeyStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS client authentication is used. The default value will be provided if trustAllRoots is false.
Default\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
    keystorePassword - The password associated with the KeyStore file. If trustAllRoots is false and keystore is empty, keystorePassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    trustKeystore - The location of the TrustStore file - a URL or the local path to it. This input is empty if no HTTPS server authentication is used. The default value will be provided if trustAllRoots is false.
Default\: /java/lib/security/cacerts
    trustPassword - The password associated with the TrustStore file.  If trustAllRoots is false and trustKeystore is empty, trustPassword default will be supplied.
Default value\: changeit
    kerberosConfFile - Location of the kerberos conf file, used for ntlm authentication.
    headerNamesList - A list containing the names of headers that should be used for the request.
Example\: Accept,Content-Type
    headerValuesList - A list containing the values of headers that should be used for the request. 
Example\: text/plain,application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    queryNamesList - A list containing the names of query parameters that should be used for the request. 
Example\: parameterName1,parameterName2 
    queryValuesList - A list containing the values of query parameters that should be used for the request. 
Example\: parameterValue1,parameterValue2
    delimiter - A delimiter that separates the elements in the names and values lists.
Default value\: , (comma).

Responses\:
    success - All URLs passed the test, and the email was successfully sent.
    failure - Something went wrong.

Note\:
If you need to specify query parameters when making the request, consider using the “queryNamesList” and “queryValuesList” inputs. The operation also accepts including query parameters in the url (Example\: http\://hostname\:80/page.asp?parameterName1\=parameterValue1¶meterName2\=parameterValue2). If you specify the same query parameter both through the "queryNamesList" and through the url input, then the value from the "queryValuesList" list will be used and not the one included in the url.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.ba095c43-80c4-4fe7-b206-58fd4658672a.prompt=Please Enter Server IP on which Service/Application Needs to be Start/Stop \: 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.beaea3f1-a09f-42fa-b6f3-c6f1e216c046.prompt=Please Enter Name of Application Needs to be Start/Stop \: 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.c44da5ca-4386-49a1-83f3-8b14b36b5ca3.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex (The values are not case sensitive)
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.c8a7dfa4-87de-41a4-8a31-d6dd17fd854b.transition.description=Failed To Start Tomcat Service On Server 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.cdef020e-6294-474e-a85b-a634c5595a40.description=
This operation runs a command, allowing you to specify whether it runs locally (no port to be specified), via SSH, Global Shell, ROSH, Telnet, or RSH.

Inputs\:
    host - The host name or IP address.
    port - The port number used to connect to the host.
    username - The user name used to connect.
    password - The password associated with the "username" input. If using a private key file, this is the passphrase for the file.
    protocol - The protocol used to run the command. 
Valid values\: SSH, ROSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, REXEC, local, WMI, NASConnectTelnet, HPOM
    timeout - The time to wait for the command to complete (in milliseconds). Increase this value if you are getting incomplete output results or a timeout.
Default value\: 90000 (90 seconds), 600000 (if protocol->WMI)
    returnImmediately - Only for local protocol. If "true", the operation executes the command and returns a result immediately.  It does not wait for the command to finish.
Valid values\: true, false.
Default value\: false.
    command - The command to run.
    arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
    environment - Specifies the environment variables and values that need to be defined when running the command.
    startDir - The path to the starting directory.
    pty - Specifies whether to use pty (used by SSH, GlobalShell)
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file on the RAS host (used by SSH, GlobalShell).
    sasHost - The host on which to run the ROSH command.
    sasHostUsername - The user name used to run the ROSH command on "sasHost".
    usernamePrompt - The prompt message for the user name. Used by the Telnet protocol. 
Default value\: When used by the NASConnectTelnet protocol, the default value is "NAS Login\:".
    passwordPrompt - The prompt message for the password associated with the "usernamePrompt"  input. Used by the Telnet protocol.  
Default value\: When used by the 'NASConnectTelnet' protocol, the default value is "Password\:"
    outputPath - The network accessible path where to store the temporary files. If you do not specify this input, it points to '\\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible, change it to use another share to which the host local system account has write access. By default, the path needs to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
    nasDevice - The NAS device on which to run the command when using the 'NASConnect' protocol.
    nasDeviceConsoleMode - The NAS device console mode used to run the command scripts running the command on the specified NAS device. If you leave this input empty, command scripts are not used, and the connections to the NAS device and the command are issued directly in the console. This is not recommended. Due to error handling capabilities limitation, the result might be a success even if the command failed to run. You can find the values for this input in the NAS web interface, as a drop-down list when creating a new command script (for example, Cisco IOS enable).
    hpomNode - The node on which to run the command.
    hpomProtocol - The protocol used to communicate with HPOM 
Valid values\: HTTP or HTTPS.
    characterSet - The name of the character set used for stream encoding and decoding between the RAS and target machine.
Valid values\: SJIS,EUC-JP, UTF-8
Default value\: UTF-8 (used by SSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, REXEC)
    escapeCharacters - A list of characters, sepparated by comma, that will be escaped from the command's arguments list. By default, this input is left blank and no characters are escaped.

Hidden Inputs\:
    useDelegation - This input only applies to the WMI protocol. If set to "true" the operation will use the 'Delegate' impersonation level and the 'Kerberos' authentication protocol. If 'false', empty or missing the operation will use 'Impersonate' for the impersonation level and the default authentication protocol (which is NTLM).
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. Used to determine the operation response, specifying whether the operation is successful or not.
    stdOut - The standard output (STDOUT) of the command.
    stdErr - The standard error (STDERR) of the command.
    exitStatus - Every command returns an exit status (sometimes referred to as a return status or exit code). A successful command returns a 0, while an unsuccessful one returns a non-zero value that usually can be interpreted as an error code. The supported protocols are\: SSH, ROSH, GlobalShell, local, WMI. 
Examples\: 0 for a successful command, 126 if the command cannot execute.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully or if the command was not yet terminated.

Notes\:
1. Telnet protocol - Since telnet is a shell protocol, not a remote execution protocol, the response is always  successful if the command is ran in the remote shell.  The return code of the specified command cannot be determined in this protocol.  If you must use the telnet protocol with this operation, make sure to check the command results. Consider using the SSH or REXEC protocol instead.
2. The "exitStatus" result for Telnet, RSH, REXEC, NasConnectTelnet, HPOM will be "" (empty). For Windows host, it will be run the following final command\: "cmd /V\:on /c   ^& echo \!ERRORLEVEL\!". For Linux host, the "; echo $?" will be appended to "command" input or "arguments" input (if the last one is not empty). 
3. If RSH protocol is used the command should be run from a machine that is in the same network as the one from the host input.
4. WMI protocol can be used only from Windows RAS. If you want to make connection from a non Windows RAS use other protocols like SSH, Telnet.
5. To enable Delayed Variable Expansion in local command, use "SETLOCAL EnableDelayedExpansion".
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.ce41476d-197a-45ce-b6aa-35b82c90a601.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.df3141a7-5545-4183-90ae-d141553fd996.description=

Valid values\: HTTP or HTTPS.
    characterSet - The name of the character set used for stream encoding and decoding between the RAS and target machine.
Valid values\: SJIS,EUC-JP, UTF-8
Default value\: UTF-8 (used by SSH, GlobalShell, Telnet, RSH, REXEC)
    escapeCharacters - A list of characters, sepparated by comma, that will be escaped from the command's arguments list. By default, this input is left blank and no characters are escaped.

Hidden Inputs\:
    useDelegation - This input only applies to the WMI protocol. If set to "true" the operation will use the 'Delegate' impersonation level and the 'Kerberos' authentication protocol. If 'false', empty or missing the operation will use 'Impersonate' for the impersonation level and the default authentication protocol (which is NTLM).
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. Used to determine the operation response, specifying whether the operation is successful or not.
    stdOut - The standard output (STDOUT) of the command.
    stdErr - The standard error (STDERR) of the command.
    exitStatus - Every command returns an exit status (sometimes referred to as a return status or exit code). A successful command returns a 0, while an unsuccessful one returns a non-zero value that usually can be interpreted as an error code. The supported protocols are\: SSH, ROSH, GlobalShell, local, WMI. 
Examples\: 0 for a successful command, 126 if the command cannot execute.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully or if the command was not yet terminated.

Notes\:
1. Telnet protocol - Since telnet is a shell protocol, not a remote execution protocol, the response is always  successful if the command is ran in the remote shell.  The return code of the specified command cannot be determined in this protocol.  If you must use the telnet protocol with this operation, make sure to check the command results. Consider using the SSH or REXEC protocol instead.
2. The "exitStatus" result for Telnet, RSH, REXEC, NasConnectTelnet, HPOM will be "" (empty). For Windows host, it will be run the following final command\: "cmd /V\:on /c   ^& echo \!ERRORLEVEL\!". For Linux host, the "; echo $?" will be appended to "command" input or "arguments" input (if the last one is not empty).

4. WMI protocol can be used only from Windows RAS. If you want to make connection from a non Windows RAS use other protocols like SSH, Telnet.
5. To enable Delayed Variable Expansion in local command, use "SETLOCAL EnableDelayedExpansion".
74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.ee5cb668-caf3-43d9-8f6a-e1ab6668c17f.prompt=Please Select Action Needs To Be Done with Application \: (Start/Stop/Reload) \: 74165547-3551-43ca-9f65-e6dd03850548.fe0ef268-34a4-4c43-91e0-68e3bad2ea15.prompt=Please Select True if Correct Application Is Deployed and Running \:
flow.name: Start_Stop_Tomcat

step.name: Check Server is Up and Tomcat Services are Running

staticBinding.value: @echo off netstat -na | find "LISTENING" | find /C /I ":8080" > NUL if %errorlevel%==0 goto :yes echo "is not running" goto :end :yes echo "is running" :end

step.name: URL Test - To Check Application is Accessible

transition.name: no more - Failed To Load URL
